\nMusic and food on their mind: Sanam ba.description: "Jaipur is always fun to visit," says lead vocalist Sanam Puri of band Sanam, as they were in Jaipur recently to perform at a private gig in the outskirts of the city. "This is not our first time. We have done a number of private events in Jaipur earlier. The weather is simply amazing during this time of the year. We performed to a lovely crowd of music aficionados (old and young). Our challenge was to make sure that we keep people of all ages entertained and hooked. Thus, we made our set list accordingly. Overall, it was a great experience being in Jaipur," he shares. With a chock-a-block schedule, the members of the band did not get enough time to explore Jaipur. Sanam says, "We reached in the daytime and straightaway headed for the sound check. Then, we got back, worked on our set list, got ready and left for the show. After the show, we did manage to eat some delicious Rajasthani food. The food was little on the spicy side but that did not stop us from gorging on the delectable food served to us. I love Jaipur ka khana." Venkat S, the bass guitarist, quips, "I love laal maans. I think it is something to die for; it’s heaven on the plate." Keshav Dhanraj, the drummer says, "I think we come to Jaipur mostly just to eat. Every time we come here, we are occupied with sound check and our show. So the only thing that we do is to gorge on Jaipur’s food and enjoy the weather."  To which Sanam jokingly adds, "This is so true. We are big-time foodies. Agar humein khaane ke liye paise milte to hum sab kitne rich hote." Venkat says that the next time when they come to the city, they would love to move around like any other tourist and see the rich heritage that the city boasts of.  On Friday, the band came up with their new song, Sanam Mennu. Sharing the idea behind the song, Venky S, says that the song has been composed keeping Valentine's Day in mind. He adds, "It's our first release this year and is our original composition. It's a light-hearted song about something most people go through while in a relationship. Since, we are four boys, the song is obviously from a boy's perspective. This is our Valentine's Day special song and we hope that everyone will relate to the lyrics and tune of this song."  (L-R) Venky S, Samar Puri, Sanam Puri and Keshav Dhanraj , members of Sanam bandThe band, Sanam, is known for its renditions of retro classics apart from their original compositions. We ask them if there are any factors that they take into consideration when they choose a retro song. To which Keshav replies that there are no factors as such. However, whichever old classic they decide to revamp, they make sure to not change the soul and melody of the song. "We grew up listening to some beautifully composed and well-written songs, an art that seems to have lost its way these days. Most of the newer music we hear today lacks the soul and complex compositions that we enjoyed listening to. As a band, we decided to make our own renditions of these amazing songs so that the newer generations can get a chance to listen to some well written and composed creations. Our renditions also connect with the older audiences because they get to hear their favourite songs presented to them in a new light. We give it our own sound and flavour, but the soul of the song remains intact."  Opening up on creative differences within the members of the band, vocalist Sanam says, "Each of us has different musical background and enjoys listening to different styles of music. The fact that we have different ideas and creative processes, helps keep our sound unique. We respect each other’s ideas and make sure that we only release a song once all of us are completely satisfied with it. Also, we work on things together so we are always open to trying different options before settling on anything."  Sanam band during their performance Talking about Rajasthani folk music, Keshav shares, "We find Rajasthani folk music interesting. There are so many unique instruments like the khartal, ravanahatha, alghoza, sarangi etc. that are used. We have a playlist on our Youtube channel only for regional music. So far, we have not attempted a Rajasthani song. But we hope to collaborate with some musicians and singers from Rajasthan to make some interesting renditions of the state's folk music. Personally, I really want to learn how to play the khartal." In Video:Music and food on their mind: Sanam band woos Jaipur's old and young alikeDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Only four CBSE students make it to Rajas.description: JAIPUR: The first cut-off list for Rajasthan College was declared on Wednesday. It also released the list of selected students as per which, this year, only four CBSE students managed to get into the college out of 556 seats in BA pass course. The figure is lower than 2018 when eight student got into the college. The reason given is the introduction of the percentile system. The similar situation is faced by other constituent colleges as well but the situation seems to be worse in Rajasthan College. This formula was introduced in 2014 in the state on the premise that scoring in the CBSE board is much easier than RBSE. Before the percentile system, about 70% CBSE students got admission while percentage of RBSE students stood at only 30%. That time state board students protested against the percentage system but after the introduction of the percentile system, CBSE students are finding it tough to get admission anywhere in the state. Expressing anger, a professor of the university said in Delhi University, CBSE cut off is lower than Rajasthan College. “Does this mean that Rajasthan College has suddenly become better than DU? This is totally against the policy of university as this is how schools are run. Moreover, RBSE schools are Hindi medium and Rajasthan College, Maharani College or Maharaja College are English medium. How will a student cope with that? We have even written to the government to discuss this issue with the university administration but got no reply,”said the professor. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

5,000 people to perform yoga in Jaisalme.description: JAISALMER: At all the BSF outposts adjoining Indo-Pak border, thousands of BSF jawans and officers will perform yoga on June 21. District administration has also launched a campaign to inspire people to do yoga. Mr Desert fame Arvind Bishnoi and Ms Moomal fame Varsha Panwarare are spreading awareness about yoga along with anganwadi workers, sarpanchs and other public representatives by distributing yellow rice in villages and hamlets. BSF Rajasthan frontier official sources said that at all the battalion headquarters and sector headquarters, BSF jawans and officers will perform yoga together. From past one month, jawans have been practicing yoga and many of them were sent for training. They are now training other people. Five thousand people will perform yoga at Shaheed Poonam Singh Stadium in Jaisalmer city. District collector Namit Mehta had called a meeting in this regard. He said that on International Yoga Day many programmes like workshops, essay writing competitions, lectures will be organised. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. In Video:Actress Urmila Matondkar meets Rahul Gandhi, joins CongressDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

\nRoyal grandeur on Jaipur roads\n.description: This is just spectacular!' That's how most foreign tourists reacted when they gathered at the Tripoliya Gate to witness the Teej procession. Trying their best to capture everything in their cameras, most of them were awestruck at the grandeur of the procession, which began from the Zanani Deorhi at City Palace. Organised by the Department of Tourism, Jaipur Municipal Corporation and City Palace, the event saw scores of folk artistes putting up a colourful show. Tourists Georgia and Elinor said, “We came only for two days and our tour guide suggested that we extended our stay to witness the Teej festivities. This is such a fantastic event. I love how the animals have been decorated with jewellery and finery .I don't think any other country has such traditions.“ What Alice Duckner from Washington DC enjoyed was relishing ghewar and applying mehndi on her hands. Duckner said, “With henna and ghewar, I am feeling a part of the festival. I'm taking such wonderful memories with me from this procession." Medical students Rory and Tom were surprised that the festival involved women fasting for the well-being of their husbands.Tom said, “We were amazed to learn that married women fast for the long life of their husbands. We don't have such festivals in Europe."Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Two brothers among three killed in Dausa.description: Jaipur: Two brothers were among three killed in an accident in Dausa on Tuesday. The police said that nobody had informed them of the accident and the bodies were bleeding profusely until a patrolling vehicle spotted them on the highway and rushed them to the hospital. The deceased have been identified as Nitin Kumar Bairwa(35), his brother Mukesh Bairwara and their uncle Dharam Pal Bairwa. “All three of them were natives of Reta village. Mukesh and his uncle Dharam Pal were taking Nitin to a hospital in Sikandra on bike when an unidentified vehicle ran over them,” said Kaushal Singh, SHO at Sikandra police station. The police told TOI that Mukesh called up his uncle and asked for his help to take Nitin to the hospital. “The trio had left for Sikandra at around 2.30am when a vehicle ran over them. The bodies were handed over to family after the post-mortem,” said an official. The police said that the exact time of the accident could not be ascertained as they got to know about the incident after a patrolling unit had spotted the bodies on early Tuesday morning. “We had informed their family members about the incident. A case has been registered. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\u2018Waada Yaad Dilao\u2019 rally on Ju.description: Jaipur: A few thousand unemployed people from different parts of the state - under the banner Rajasthan Berojgar Ekikrit Mahasangh - will organise a "Waada Yaad Dilao" rally on July 1 by taking out a march from 22 Godam to the state assembly. The objective of this "padyatra" is to remind the Congress government of their promises made ahead of the assembly elections to create jobs in the state on a priority basis. "More than 50,000 recruitments are still pending in Rajasthan. These are those cases in which admission tests have been conducted but joining is still pending. Our demand is to recruit the unemployed persons in various departments like power, education, health, technical and others departments, wherever there are vacancies. Apart from these, the government should also create new positions in these departments," said Upen Yadav, president, Rajasthan Berojgar Ekikrit Mahasangh. "About 3000-4000 people will be participating in the the padyatra on July 1 from various parts of the state. We had supported Congress party after meeting its president Rahul Gandhi ahead of the the assembly elections. The 'Waada Yaad Dilao' rally is aimed at reminding the government of their promises and also appeal to them to fulfill those. They had promised to resolve the problem of unemployement on a priority basis," he added stating that there are more than 20 associations linked with the Mahasangh with around 15 lakh members. He also said a delegation of a few will also try to meet the Chief Minister (Ashok Gehlot) or the deputy chief minister (Sachin Pilot) on the same day. According to the National Career Service (NCS) data, Rajasthan has 5.37 lakh registered unemployed people and the Jaipur district has the highest number of them at 48,650 up to April 30 this year. Rajasthan deputy chief minister Sachin Pilot had earlier accused the previous Vasundhara Raje government of cheating the youth as her government failed to create 15 lakh jobs in the state as promised. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\u2018Take over land of errant cooperati.description: JAIPUR: Cooperative minister Udailal Anjana said that the land of agricultural cooperative credit societies which failed to achieve the stated purpose, would be taken over by the state government. “If the societies have gone astray, the department should prepare a list of such societies and take over the property of such societies”, he said. Anjana was addressing the review meeting of departmental officials in the Secretariat on Tuesday. He asked the officials to ensure sufficient stock of urea and DAP for the kharif season. He said buffer stocks should be made for supply of manure so that farmers could get supply of fertilizers on time. The process of online registration for crop loan is in progress and those registered farmers will get loan shortly, said the minister. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Showers expose loopholes in Jaipur munic.description: JAIPUR: All the tall claims of the Jaipur municipal corporation (JMC) on monsoon preparedness fell flat on Tuesday morning with just a few hours of rain resulting in flooding and sinking of city roads. JMC received many complaints of waterlogging and roads sinking in, from all over the city. At Chandi ki Taksaal, the roads were completely clogged with water and commuters going to offices were facing difficulty in crossing the road on two-wheelers. Manoj Jangid, a resident of the area said he had to go back to his house to change clothes, as his pants got dirty due to the dirty water on the road while he was riding his two-wheeler. “Two-wheeler riders were facing difficulty while travelling as the roads were waterlogged and cars were moving fast. I saw one person on a bike without his shirt, to prevent it from getting stained from the dirty water. The situation is even more difficult for pedestrians,” said Manoj. People around secretariat near deer park area were faced with traffic snarls, where unmetalled roads due to the laying of pipeline, jammed the traffic for half an hour. Most of the big nullahs were over flowing on roads causing traffic jams at various places in the city. Ishwar Chand Sharma, an auto driver said that at Sudershanpura near Bais Godam puliya, there was traffic jam for about half an hour and mud-filled roads with water were making commute difficult. “I have never seen the situation of Jaipur change. We have to drive carefully as due to water, pits are not visible that may cause accidents. Two-wheeler drivers have to be more careful,” said Ishwar. There are around 867 small drains and 20 nullahs in the city. As per the JMC officials, cleaning of almost all the drains is completed but they are still waiting to tender the 20 big nullahs. However, residents of Nari ka Nakah said that no one has visited their areas for cleaning. Babuddin said, “Drains are all clogged and they are overflowing. Yesterday, we paid a contractor from our own pocket to clean the drains as the monsoon will be coming soon and these drains will be choked, emitting foul smell.” District collector Jagroop Yadav accepted the fact and said that since morning, they had received around four complaints of water-logging from various areas of the city. “We immediately sent mud pumps in those areas to pump out water. We are fully prepared for the monsoon. There are no casualties reported as of now. There are three flood-control rooms in Jaipur that are well-equipped with any emergency vehicles like trucks or tractors,” said Yadav. There are three flood-control rooms in the city functioning from the fire station of Mansarovar, Ghat Gate and Bunny Park. Abha Beniwal, deputy commissioner fire, while talking to TOI explained the JMC’s preparation for the monsoon. “Around 30 members are working in the flood-control rooms. We have ordered sand bags that will be used in case of soil erosion to fill up the place or roads. We have issued orders to all the community halls not to take any bookings in this season as they can be used in emergency for shifting people from slums. We have also ordered tents and mattresses for emergency. Our preparedness is complete for the monsoon,” claimed Beniwal. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Cops bust diesel theft racket in Jaipur,.description: JAIPUR: The city police on Wednesday unearthed a major diesel theft racket operating in Rajawas area for past one year. Police have detained at least four suspects in the case. The police were taken aback after they discovered several small pipes illegally connected with the main underground diesel distribution line. Sources informed TOI that pipes were found to be supplying diesel to three houses, where scores of plastic drums were found brimming with illegally procured diesel. “These barrel drums were being used to supply diesel into the black market. It is not easy to break the underground line as there are several anti-theft alarm systems,” said an official, adding that the collusion of oil company officials cannot be ruled out yet. The city police have detained at least four suspects in the case and till late in the night, different units were raiding nearby localities. “We have unearthed a stockpile of diesel at a house. From there, the stolen oil was packed onto trucks and tractors for smuggling,” the official added. DCP Vikas Sharma said that investigation was at a very early stage. However, highly placed sources confirmed the involvement of a gang. “The matter came to light when at a check point, cops intercepted a pick-up vehicle supplying diesel. When the cops interrogated him, he failed to provide a satisfactory answer,” the official said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rajasthan to soon have Right to Health A.description: JAIPUR: State government is all set to bring in Right to Health Act. Health minister Raghu Sharma, while felicitating doctors for their valuable contribution to healthcare at Times Icons of Health 2019-Rajasthan, organised by The Times of India, Jaipur, said, “We are conducting exercise to bring Right to Health Act and soon it will be sent to the chief minister for his approval. We are taking measures to provide ‘right to health’ to people by bringing an Act on it.” The programme was part of The Times of India's 11th anniversary celebrations. He said that the party had promised the same in the election manifesto and now they are all set to fulfil it. “The right to health will ensure that even the most underprivileged person in the state gets treatment,” the minister said. Sharma sought help of the people of the state and also doctors and paramedical staff in effectively implementing tge proposed Right to Health Act, after it gets its nod in the state assembly. The minister also talked about challenges such as shortage of doctors. “We are recruiting paramedical staff. We will soon start the process for recruiting more doctors,” he said. Besides, he said that the government will also bring an Act to keep a check on food adulteration. “We have conducted a campaign to check food adulteration in the state and we found that synthetic chemicals were used in food items. We are concerned about the health of the people and for that purpose we will also bring an Act to check food adulteration,” he said. Sharma said that the Gehlot-led Congress government had successfully implemented free medicine and free diagnostic schemes, which are now on expansion mode. He said expensive medicines for treatment of kidney, cancer and heart will also be added to the list of free medicines provided by the government hospitals to the patients. “These are quite costly medicines but we are adding them to ensure that a patient from an underprivileged background is not deprived of treatment,” he said adding that free medicines are available upto the sub-centre level in the rural areas Sharma also talked about ban imposed on sale of e-cigarettes by the government to save youths with such habit. He said that government is taking measures to discourage use of tobacco. In an event organised across that state recently, in a single day 1.14 crore people took pledge not to consume tobacco. The World Health Organisation (WHO) has also acknowledged the efforts and awarded the state health department for discouraging tobacco consumption. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Govt adds Nepal in free religious tour f.description: Jaipur: Senior citizens in Rajasthan can now go on a pilgrimage to Pashupatinath in Nepal free of cost. Announcing the details of the free religious tours for senior citizens during 2019-20, tourism and Devasthan minister Vishvendra Singh said number of circuits has been increased up to nine this year. Additionally, the age eligibility criteria of 70 years has been lowered to 65 years. In the air travel category, Dehradun-Haridwar- Rishikesh, Gangasagar-Dakshineswar Kali temple-Belur Math-Kolkata, and Pashupatinath-Nepal have been added, taking the total number of circuits to nine. For the train tours, two more circuits such as Khawaja Moinuddin Chisti (Ajmer Dargah)-Nizamuddin Auliya (Delhi)-tomb of Salim Chishti (Fatehpur Sikri) and Goverdhan- Barsana-Mathura-Vrindavan have been included. Under the scheme, the Devasthan department will provide free travel and accommodation to 10,000 pilgrims (5,000 each for train and air travel). However, the department has reserved 5% seats for journalists in both categories but they will be eligible if they are above 60 years of age. In the meeting held on Wednesday in the presence of principal secretary tourism Sreya Guha and other top officials of the department, it was also decided to include the retired government officials who were not eligible earlier to avail the scheme. The senior citizen pilgrimage scheme will be effective from July 5 and the application process will be done through online. The minister said that awareness about the scheme will be created at the district level so that more and more people from rural areas can take benefit. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

fbb Colors Femina Miss India World 2019.description: fbb Colors Femina Miss India World 2019 Suman Rao talks about her special connect with her native state RajasthanIn a star-studded ceremony in Mumbai, Rajasthan’s Suman Rao was crowned fbb Colors Femina Miss India World 2019. Suman was born in a village named Aidena, near Udaipur. When she was barely a year old, Suman and her family shifted to Mumbai. She told us, “My maternal grandparents still live there and so do many of my distant relatives. Even though I shifted to Mumbai, I have not forgotten my roots. Every summer, I visit my grandparents in Aidena. I also come here to attend family functions.” Talking about her grand win and the celebration back in Rajasthan, she said, “The entire village is ecstatic about my win and celebrating it. I plan to visit Udaipur for my homecoming now.” Suman, who is currently pursuing a Chartered Accountancy course and B.Com from University of Mumbai and also learning Kathak, said that she had auditioned for Miss India from Jaipur. Her father, Ratan Singh Rao, is a jeweller, while mother Sushila Kunwar Rao is a homemaker. She has two brothers, Jitendra and Chirag. Her entire family is overwhelmed with joy at her win.  (L-R) Jitendra Rao (brother), Ratan Singh Rao (father), Suman Rao, Sushila Kunwar Rao (mother) and Chirag Singh Rao (brother) Jitendra says, “We are all extremely happy for her. We were always confident that she would win the title. We are now looking forward to Miss World and hope that she wins there too.” During the pageant, Suman said that “I come from a community where gender inequality and other stereotypes are still into existence, so when I saw two primary choices in front of me, to either accept the conditions those were in existence or to take the responsibility for changing the same, I chose the latter one.”  Suman attended Mahatma School of Academics and Sports, Navi Mumbai I HAVE ALWAYS SUPPORTED AND NURTURED HER PASSION: SUMAN’S FATHER“Instead of pushing or forcefully making her do something, I have always supported and nurtured her passion and allowed her to follow what excites her the most. We are extremely happy for her and proud of her achievements. Suman was inclined towards modeling since her college days and as father, I have always motivated her. She is also learning Kathak. I just wish the best for all my children,” says Ratan Singh Rao, Suman’s father. 'IT'S A MATTER OF GREAT PRIDE'‘It’s a matter of great pride and honour to be able to wear the crown of fbb Colors Femina Miss World. The feeling is inexlicable. I hope I make every Indian proud and will give my best to keep the crown as high as every Miss India took it,’ Suman wrote on her Insta handle Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nGlamour galore at Jaipur wedding\n.description: At the sangeet and ring ceremony of film distributor Raj Bansal’s son Abhimanyu in Jaipur, Bollywood celebs Sanjay Dutt with wife Maanayata and kids, Rishi Kapoor and Tanishaa Mukerji were seen in attendance. They’re in town to attend Abhimanyu and Suvarna’s wedding. Hosted at a farmhouse, the evening began with a sangeet ceremony where the family members of the bride and groom presented dance performances. The couple too performed to a medley of songs.  Rishi Kapoor was among the first few guests to reach the venue before the ceremony started. Sanjay Dutt along with his family reached quite late and was reportedly expected to present a dance performance to his song Tamma Tamma Loge, but that did not happen. However, the song kept playing in the backdrop. Tanishaa performed at the groom’s residence during the mehndi ceremony. She told us, “This is the first wedding I’m attending in Jaipur and everything looks so majestic. I’m enjoying every bit of it. Now I know why the city is a hot destination for weddings.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rajasthan to set up Vedic Sanskar and Sh.description: JAIPUR: The Congress government in the state is set to form a Vedic Sanskar and Shikshan Board (VSSB) to revive the ancient practices related to education, philosophy and healthcare. The government on Monday formed a committee to define its aim, objective and functioning. It seems that the Congress is following in the footsteps of the previous BJP government, which had initiated a number of measures including setting up of the Rajasthan Institute of Mantra Science, to revive Sanskrit. Higher education minister Subhash Garg told TOI, “The entire world is embracing the ancient wisdom of Bharat Varsha. The board’s activities and programmes would aim at reconnecting with the old roots. Primarily, it will work to promote scientific temperament in the society based on our ancient texts. It will explore the ways to embed the ancient wisdom in the curriculum.” Once the committee will submit its report, the department will constitute the board and appoint its members. The committee members have been directed to make education modules based on Vedic period relevant to contemporary subjects. “The ancient texts have a solution to the modern day problems related to environment, sustainable development, human rights, economy, ethics etc. It is unfortunate that the west has developed theories and concepts around our wisdom, while we have turned a blind eye to them,” said Garg. The task of the board will be to create awareness in schools on Vedic sciences. The state has Vedic schools but their curriculum is restricted to chanting of verses only. “These Vedic schools will run in the format of Guru-Shishya parampara with residential facilities. It will deal with meditation, yoga along with subjects like science, mathematics, and Sanskrit for research,” said Garg. Besides, budding writers and scholars will be provided with an opportunity to publish their books, articles and engage in discourse with other scholars,” added Garg. Other than spreading scientific temperament, the board will also aim to revive the old value system or sanskar. The committee members are expected to create a mechanism for spreading the values prevalent in the Vedic period like 16 sanskars-- Garbadhan, Punsavan to Antim sanskar. \nMarriage, pakode and Jaipur on funnyma.description: Necessity may well be the mother of all inventions, but for comedian Maheep Singh, what could possibly have been the necessity to create pakode is hard to fathom. In Jaipur last Saturday to perform at the Birla Auditorium, he asked the audience, “Who would have thought ki sabzi ko besan mein daal kar, usko fry kiya jayega? It is boredom which is the mother of all inventions, not necessity.” He added, “And marriage is another example of boredom.” These were only a few of the quips directed at the audience by the stand-up comedian during his gig.  From creation of language, evolution of mankind, Valentine’s Day and how he ruined his father’s publishing business to him dealing with depression – Maheep’s session had an amusing take on all of these. “We created the definition of success and failure and now we’ve restricted ourselves in our head. It’s important to embrace failure or you will never learn. Failure is inevitable. After experiencing one failure after the other, I turned into a really angry person who felt depressed and dejected. In that state, I could have easily shot anybody who tried to mess with my head. The choice was clear – to give in to the anger or make people laugh using comedy. I chose the latter,” he said as he addressed a young audience.  Those expecting Rajasthani jokes didn’t get to hear any because Maheep didn’t know any. “I only crack jokes about sardaars because it’s good to laugh at yourself,” he told us, adding, “I enjoy Marwari jokes, but unfortunately I don’t know any. Now I will learn some so that whenever I am in Jaipur next, I can crack some Marwari jokes or those directed at the people of Jaipur,” he added. Talking about what makes for a good stand-up comedian, he said, “A good stand-up comedian acts as a vent for people to channel their everyday frustration. So if you cuss at a politician, people enjoy it because deep down they’re also tired of their country’s political system. Woh gaali dena chahate hain, aur ek stand-up comedian unki feelings ko voice karta hai.”  Having performed in Jaipur many times, Maheep is glad that the city now witnesses several comedy gigs. He said, “Jaipur is a city that never fails to impress me. People of Jaipur are very receptive and I am happy to know that comedy gigs are happening so frequently in this city.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Moderate showers in Rajasthan over next.description: JAIPUR: Heavy rains lashed parts of eastern Rajasthan in the past 24 hours, the meteorological department said on Wednesday. Pratapgarh recorded 28 cm of rainfall, followed by 19 cm in Chittorgarh, 17 cm and 16 cm in Sabla and Aspur of Dungargarh district, respectively, an official said. Various other places received 7-15 cm of rainfall in the last 24 hours. On Wednesday, Barmer recorded 9.6 mm of rainfall, followed by 4 mm in Kota, 1 mm in Jaisalmer and 0.1 mm in Jaipur, the official said. Sriganganagar recorded the state's highest maximum temperature at 41.3 degrees Celsius, followed by 40.5 in Barmer, 40 in Bikaner, 39.6 in Churu, 39.4 in Jodhpur and 32.6 in Jaipur, the weather department said. It has forecast light to moderate rainfall at many places in east Rajasthan and at isolated places in west Rajasthan in the next 24 hours. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rajasthan University: Stiff competition.description: JAIPUR: Rajasthan University’s constituent colleges – Maharani’s College and Maharaja’s College declared their first cut off list on Wednesday. Both the colleges show a slight rise by in the cut offs as compared to last year. This year, there is around 5% to 10% difference between the RBSE and CBSE cut off list. The reason for such vast difference between the two boards is the percentile formula. This formula was introduced in 2014 by the former BJP government to upgrade the students under the RBSE, who were lagging behind in securing admission in colleges. The reason given was that the marking pattern of CBSE is more lenient than that of RBSE, where a student has to struggle a lot to get even a first division. Though this formula clearly uplifted RBSE students but the number of CBSE students have gone down. There are many subjects like BSc Mathematics pass course and Hindi Honours where the number of students from CBSE is nil as the students were not able to get high percentile. Anvi Jain, a CBSE student who scored 95% in Class XII board couldn’t get into BA pass course in Mathematics. She said, “Not every one can afford to study out of state. Even we are residents of this state then why such discrimination. This is complete injustice as even after scoring so high we are not able to get into best institution.” There has been a demand for the increase of 10% seats in the university as done every year on pretext of getting more applications. Although this year there has been a decline in the number of forms received as compared to last year when around 50,000 applications were received. This year the number has gone down to 40,000. Rajasthan University administration has clarified that they can increase the seats only for EWS because they do not have proper infrastructure to accommodate so many students. Economically Weaker Section (EWS) quota is another confusion that college administration is facing as Rajasthan University has not received any guidelines for the quota. EWS quota was announced by the central government to give reservations to the economically weaker sections of students in jobs, universities and colleges. As per the announcement, 10% seats will be increased in all the universities and colleges. However, no instruction has been received by the college administration yet. One beaten to death over minor scuffle.description: ALWAR: One person was beaten to death and several others were critically injured after a minor scuffle between two factions in Ramgarh tehsil of Alwar took an ugly turn on Tuesday. The deceased has been identified as Bansi Ram (54) who was beaten to death. The injured are undergoing treatment at Rajeev Gandhi Hospital in Alwar. The police informed TOI that two youths of two different villages under Ramgarh tehsil had clashed with each other over some parking dispute involving their bikes. The minor tiff escalated soon after but the two parties decided to settle the matter amicably by sitting down and speaking to each other on Monday night. But the matter did not die down and the case snowballed into a major spat to settle old grudges. “One person was killed in the accident while seven others have been injured. We are taking statements of those who were involved in the case to understand as to what really transpired,” added an official. The police said that an FIR has been filed in the case. Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

19 Pak Hindus in Barmer granted Indian c.description: JAISALMER: As many as 19 Hindus from Pakistan, residing in Barmer district for past many years, were given Indian citizenship on Wednesday. Barmer district collector Himanshu Gupta and additional district collector Rakesh Kumar Sharma handed them over the certificates of citizenship at the conference hall at collectorate. The Pak Hindus expressed their happiness and elation by distributing sweets. They said after getting Indian citizenship, their dream of many years to become an Indian has come true. District collector Himanshu Gupta and ADM Rakesh Sharma after giving away the certificates of Indian citizenship, extended their wishes and requested them to get their names added to the voters’ list. These 19 Pak-displaced Hindus were residing in Barmer district for more than a decade now and the government finally gave them Indian citizenship. Junior assistant Dayaram Gurjar was present as representative of home department on this occasion. The 19 persons who were given Indian citizenship are: Samand Kanwar, Rehmat Singh, Dharmendra, Devidan, Sujan Singh, Lal Ji, Dhel Kanwar, Evan Bai, Rekha, Manwar Singh, Vasand Kanwar, Phool Kumari, Nand Kanwar, Hadmat Singh, Taru Bai, Kiran Bai, Bablu Kanwar, Dheena Bai and Pintu Bai. Four of them belong from a family — Lal ji, his wife Rekha Kanwar, son Hadmat Singh and daughter Kiran. It is to be mentioned that recently, the state government had ordered to give citizenship to 34 Pakistan-displaced Hindus — 19 in Barmer, 10 in Pali and five in Jalore, and from January 2019 to June 17, 2019, as many as 79 Pakistan-displaced Hindus have been given Indian citizenship. It is to be noted that every week, around 5-6 Hindu families are coming on visa from Pakistan in Thar Express, after being subjected to forced conversion and atrocities in Pakistan, and thus they do not return and permanently settle in India. As a result, thousands of Pak-displaced Hindus are still waiting for Indian citizenship. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Man commits suicide after wife hangs sel.description: Jaipur: A couple committed suicide following a tiff over scrap newspapers in Bagru on Wednesday afternoon. The police said that when Chote Lal(33) learnt that his wife Mamta had committed suicide by hanging herself, he went to a nearby railway station and jumped in front of a moving train. The shocking incident happened when the couple was working together at their under-construction house. “Chote Lal had asked Mamta that plumbers would need some old newspapers. It was a rural area so there were hardly any scrap dealers. She returned and told her husband that she could not find any old newspapers. Chote Lal was miffed and retorted that she was of no use,” said sub-inspector Rameshwar Dayal. The argument broke out between the couple and they accused each other of not helping in the work. “Labourers, who were working in the house, tried to pacify them. But Mamta went to her parents’ house in Jaisinghpura. She locked herself in and committed suicide,” Dayal said, adding that a few minutes later Chote Lal was informed about her death. “After Lal saw Mamta’s body, he went to a nearby railway station on his bike and jumped before a moving train. He was killed on the spot,” the official told TOI, adding that their bodies were shifted to the mortuary for the post-mortem. The police said that Chote Lal has worked in Middle East as a labourer. “After his return from abroad, the couple brought a piece of land and began the construction. Apart from other labourers, both Mamta and Chote Lal were also involved in the construction of their dream house,” a police official said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Raj on alert after AES deaths in Bihar.description: Jaipur: Taking a serious note on deaths of over 100 children due to acute encephalitis syndrome (AES) in Bihar, health minister Raghu Sharma issued alert on the disease in the state. Health minister Raghu Sharma said that they are concerned on the deaths of children in Bihar due to AES. “We are issuing an alert on AES in the state. Directions have been issued to all the health officials in the state to remain alert on the disease. If they see children with symptoms of AES, they should immediately provide them treatment on priority,” said Sharma. However, he also appealed to the people to remain alert on the disease and to keep a watch on health of their children to take treatment immediately. A case of AES is defined when a person of any age, at any time of the year is detected with acute fever and a change in mental status (including symptoms such as confusion, disorientation, coma, or inability to talk) and new onset of seizures (excluding simple febrile seizures). Other early clinical findings may include an increase in irritability, somnolence or abnormal behaviour greater than that seen with usual febrile illness. Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Jaip\u200bur: Two mining mafia aides arr.description: JAIPUR: Almost a week after mining mafia mowed down a 60-year-old man in Kardhani, who was opposed to their illegal trade, Kardhani police arrested two more accused on Monday late night. Speaking to TOI, SHO Mohammad Islam Khan said that Nand Lal (25) a resident of Nagaur and Hans Raj (48) a native of Tonk, were arrested. “The two accused were on a bike that was escorting the truck transporting the illegally mined sand. The victim, Kishore Singh had confronted them for smuggling bajri through residential colonies,” he said. The police said that two accused were active participants in the murder conspiracy, as they were present when Singh was mowed down. The police had earlier arrested the dumper driver Jagdish Prasad Jat in the murder case. The truck’s registered owner remains elusive. On June 12, Kishore Singh was killed after a dumper truck transporting illegally mined bajri mowed him down right outside his house in Kardhani. The senior citizen had been objecting to trucks transporting bajri through the Ganga Vihar colony. Bajri mining in Rajasthan is banned by the Supreme Court. A CCTV footage recovered by the police indicated that Singh’s death was a premeditated murder. The truck was later seized by the Kardhani police. One of Singh’s neighbours had alleged that the dumper truck had swerved right to run over Singh. “I was standing barely a few inches away from where Kishore ji was killed. I’m clear that the truck driver deliberately mowed him down,” said Lokesh, Singh’s neighbour. There is a Supreme Court ban on mining bajri in Rajasthan but that hasn’t stopped the mafia from spreading its wings. The mining mafia, allegedly operating in collusion with police and state mining department, has set off a blood-letting spree in Rajasthan through attacks on locals who have opposed the illegal trade. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

HC issues notices to convener of CLAT-20.description: JAIPUR: A single bench of Rajasthan High Court on Monday issued notices to the consortium of National Law Universities, common law admission test-2019(CLAT-2019) through its convener for one of the objective type questions out of 200 questions asked in the exam. The petitioner claimed that for a question there were two right answers out of four given options; however the examinee considered only one option due to which 1.25 marks of the petitioner were deducted. Vacation bench of Justice Indrajit Singh gave this order while giving an initial hearing on the petition filed by one Rochit Baklewal. In the petition, counsel for the petitioner Kinshuk Jain told the court that the CLAT test was conducted on May 26 for admission to the five-year law course at National Law Schools. “Since the petitioner Rohit too appeared for the CLAT-2019 exam there was a question asking ‘in which field Golden Peacock Award is given?’ The exam organizer issued a reply key considering the answer as - corporate governance. The petitioner had given a different answer and realized it only after answer key was released. Thus petitioner lost one marks for the wrong answer and .25 marks as negative marking,” said Jain. The next hearing in the matter will be on June 26. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Govt to come up with mental health autho.description: Jaipur: Aiming to look after the system of mental health services in the state, state government has decided to constitute a State Mental Health Authority (SMHA) under the provisions of the Mental Healthcare Act, 2017. After the formation of SMHA, no person or organisation will be able to establish or run a mental health establishment unless it has been registered with the authority under the provisions of the Act. Besides, the minimum quality standards of mental health services will be as specified by regulations made by the state authority. SMHA will work with an objective to provide mental healthcare and services for persons with mental disorders and to protect, promote and fulfil the rights of such persons during delivery of mental healthcare and services. National mental health programme (state unit) Dr Pradeep Sharma said that the members of the state authority will be psychiatrists, clinical psychologist, psychiatric social worker, psychiatric nurse, non-government organisation, those who take care of patients with mental disorder and mentally healthy individuals. The National Mental Health Programme has invited applications from individuals/organisation for nomination as non-official members of the SMHA to be constituted under the Mental Healthcare Act-2017. Since mental health is emerging as a major issue as a lot of cases of depression and other such disorders are being reported at psychiatric centres, the SMHA will play a key role in improving mental healthcare facilities. SMHA will register all mental health establishments in the state. It will develop quality service norms for different types of mental health establishments in the state. Moreover, it will supervise all mental health establishments in the state and receive complaints about deficiencies in provision of services, the health department officials said. Moreover, it will register clinical psychologists, mental health nurses and psychiatric social workers in the state to work as mental health professionals. It will train all relevant persons including law enforcement officials, mental health professionals and other health professionals about the provisions and implementation of the Act. The SMHA will meet not less than four times in a year. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

62 cows dead after consuming poisonous f.description: JAIPUR: In tragic incident, 62 cows died in a gaushala at Shridungarpur near Bikaner after consuming poisonous grass on Monday evening. As per the officials, a contractor was hired to supply green feed for the 200 cows in the gaushala. On the unfortunate day, the contractor supplied stunted jowar feed to the gaushala which had hydrogen cyanide (HCN). This poison acted immediately and within a span of half an hour some 30 cows were dead. Ranjeet Singh, additional director, Animal Husbandry Bikaner division, said, “When the jowar is not fully grown the quantity of HCN in it is high that can be dangerous for animals. With continuous rainfall and when the jowar is fully grown its quantity decreases with time. On Monday, someone supplied stunted jowar. It barely took an hour for the cows to collapse and die. It came as a shock to us and immediately our team left for Shridungarpur.” “A team of doctors was called for a post-mortem after which they were buried,” he added. An investigation into the matter has been ordered to know the intention of the suppliers. “We have ordered to dispose of the remaining green feed in the godown to avoid any future tragedy. Sample of the feed has been sent to the laboratory and we are waiting for the results to come. One team of doctors and officials is still present at the gaushala to monitor the ongoing functioning,” said Singh. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Smugglers flee with three cows from Bhar.description: ALWAR: The growing menace of cow smugglers was on full display in Bharatpur where unidentified cattle smugglers allegedly took away cows from a gaushala (cow shelter) and beat up the care taker on late Tuesday night. The alleged incident took place under the limits of Kaman police station area. “Gaushala care taker Kanhaiya Lal, also known here as babaji, filed a complaint that some cattle smugglers had attacked him and fled with cows,” said SHO, Vinod Savariya. “The accused took away three cows said,” additional SP (ASP) Deeg Mahesh Meena. “The suspects have not been unidentified. The care taker said that the accused had come in a vehicle but he was unable to recall the registration number of the vehicle,” Meena said adding that Lal sustained injuries on his hand. “The care taker alleged that he was thrashed by the accused when he confronted them. Our teams are looking into the matter and we have registered an FIR under Rajasthan Bovine Animal Act,” Meena told TOI, adding that teams have been made to nab the accused. The problem of cattle smuggling has been gradually increasing in the Mewat area which also includes Alwar and Bharatpur region of Rajasthan. The two districts also have dedicated ‘cow protection check posts’ to curb the menace of cattle smuggling. While the efforts are underway to nab the gang, the locals have alleged that police laxity has emboldened the smuggling gangs to steal cows from gaushala. The Mewat region is infamous for criminal gangs including the smugglers who transport cows and firearms to Haryana and Uttar Pradesh. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kota is the new Kashi of education: PM M.description: Jaipur: Popularly known as the coaching destination for national level competitive examinations, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday termed Kota as the 'Kashi of education' while congratulating its newly-elected MP Om Birla for his election as the new Lok Sabha Speaker. "Kota is the same land, which has now, kind of, become the Kashi of education. Those who give priority to their careers with heart and soul, love Kota," said Modi during his congratulatory speech in Lok Sabha. "They live in Kota, study in Kota and shape their careers from Kota. A small city in one corner of Rajasthan has turned into a 'mini India' today. His name is Shriman Om Birlaji under whose leadership, contribution and initiative, Kota has transformed in this manner," he added while praising Birla's work as a parliamentarian and also hailing the coaching destination of the country. "I wish you very good luck on behalf of me, the House and the treasury bench," Modi concluded. TNN Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

7-10% difference to qualify for CBSE & R.description: JAIPUR: Rajasthan University’s affiliated, Commerce College, Jaipur released its first cut off list on Wednesday. As compared to last year there has been a slight rise in the cut off percentage. As per the list there is a difference of 7% to 10% between CBSE and RBSE students. In BCom pass course there is an increase by 2% in RBSE general category in 2019 while the CBSE cut off remained the same this year. In BCom honours courses, cut off remained between 80% to 91% in general category for RBSE students. In CBSE, it remained between 89% to 93% this year. Vice principal of Commerce College, Dilip Singh said the difference between RBSE and CBSE remained because of the percentile formula. “Earlier, CBSE students used to get admission easily but now the ball is in the court of RBSE students. Though 20% CBSE students are still getting admission here, their number is going down every year,” said Dilip. Another problem that was pointed out this year was that there is not mention of Economically Weaker Section (EWS) quota declared by the government in the forms. Jaipur\u2019s PG facilities popular amon.description: JAIPUR: After applying for admissions in universities and colleges, students begin the endless search for hostels that meet their budget and required facilities. Finding an ideal hostel is an uphill task for the outstation students who run from one area to another in the city. TOI scanned areas like Raja Park, Gopalpura Bypass, Mansarover, C-Scheme and Bani Park which are hub for hostels and rented accommodations . Raja Park turned out to be the most popular destination for students for hostels and paying guest (PG) accommodation. Its closeness to several institutes has made the area most preferred and expensive. Eateries that have come up in the last three years have also added to its popularity. Some high-end hostels which are fully air-conditioned, have thumb impression regulated entry and exit, RO water, round-the-clock security, Wi-Fi, dining space, multi-cuisine food, in-house party area, doctor on call that charge from Rs 8,000 to 25,000. Rita Kharbanda of Vatsalya Hostel who has 100 rooms in different locations in Raja Park, said, “The first thing that parents and students look for is safety. Girls and women can go for a walk till late in the night.” Mansarovar and Gopalpura Bypass are other popular areas for the PG accommodation. These areas have easy connectivity to educational institutes and coaching centres. Since the area is wide several families have started subletting extra rooms of their houses to the students. Pragya Bhatnagar, a resident of Triveni Nagar, said, “We sublet rooms to girls. Generally, three to four girls stay in a room and most of them prepare for competitive exams like SSC, RAS. There are no security issues in the colony as it is a residential area with CCTV cameras.” Almost all the PGs are very particular about the timings and impose restrictions on the students. Generally, the time limit is till 10pm and after that the students are not allowed to enter the hostel. They follow proper safety guidelines. Ankita Singh, owner of a girl's PG in C-Scheme, said, “We have both students and working professionals. Jaipur is still an orthodox city so we are very particular about cleanliness and timings. We don’t allow girls to enter and exit the premises after 9.30pm unless it is urgent. We keep their parents or local guardians in loop. The rent ranges from Rs 7,000 to 8,000 for double sharing rooms and Rs 5,000 to 6,000 for triple sharing rooms.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

JDA aims to develop 35 greewood parks to.description: JAIPUR: The Jaipur Development Authority (JDA) will develop 35 greenwood parks in the city. The aim of this scheme is to plant trees instead of grass and flowers to save water. The scheme is about having plantation in the city parks where there are no borewells or the borewells have become dry due to which irrigation facility is not available. In these parks around 5,520 trees will be planted which will be maintained by Jaipur Development Authority for the next two years. Senior horticulturist S P Bhadu of JDA while talking to TOI explained, “This idea was discussed to save as much water as possible because in flowering plants, grass and other gardens hundreds of litres of water is wasted and they need more maintenance. Once the trees are planted they require water only 3-4 times every month. Hence, they will be easily maintained. The entire operations will cost us around Rs 38.92 lakh.” As monsoon is approaching, government will distribute around 21,000 saplings to the residents of the city who would have to take care of the plants later. These plants can be taken from the public parks of the area. Similarly, JDA will even plant saplings in government schools and office premises that will later be maintained by the respective departments. Recently, JDA had put QR code on a few trees in Central Park. Any person can scan the code from his mobile and get information about the tree – species, usage and place of origin. While explaining this scheme Bhadu said, “We have launched it recently and around six trees in the Central Park have this facility. The plan is to gradually spread it to more plants and trees in the Central Park and other public parks of the city.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ramdas Athawale.description: NEW DELHI: Union minister and Republican Party of India leader Ramdas Athawale on Wednesday left members of the Lok Sabha, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in peels of laughter with his witty remarks, some aimed at Congress president Rahul Gandhi. In his congratulatory remarks after the unanimous election of Om Birla as Lok Sabha Speaker, Athawale, who has a knack for spontaneous humour, said he is happy that Rahul got a chance to sit in Lok Sabha though as an opposition member. While Rahul won from Wayanad in Kerala, he lost the Gandhi stronghold of Amethi in Uttar Pradesh to Smriti Irani. #WATCH:Ramdas Athawale in Lok Sabha says,"Rahul ji aapko wahan baithne ka mauka mila isiliye aapko badhai deta hoon… https://t.co/cRPL9IbuWV— ANI (@ANI) 1560939466000"Rahul ji aapko wahan baithne ka mauka mila isiliye aapko badhai deta hoon. Jab apki satta thi tab main aapke saath tha. Chunav ke pehle mujhe Congress wale bol rahe the idhar aao. Maine hawa ka rukh dekha ki woh Modi ji ki taraf ja rahi hai (I congratulate you on getting an opportunity to sit there (in the Opposition benches). I was with the UPA when it was in power. Congress leaders asked me to join them again ahead of elections. But I saw which way the wind was blowing and decided to remain with NDA," he said. Rahul and Sonia took his remarks sportingly and were seen smiling. When the RPI leader was speaking, Modi was seen laughing on more than two occasions. "Now, our government will run for five years, and for another five years ... Modi sahib will continue to do the good work. We will not let you come this side (treasury benches) so easily," Athawale said, amid thumping of desks by NDA members. Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi.
